title: Valid Anagram
description: Given two strings s and t, return true if t is an anagram of s, and false otherwise. An anagram uses the exact same characters with the same frequencies.

steps.explanation: We have s = 'anagram' and t = 'nagaram'. An anagram has the same characters with the same frequency. We'll use a HashMap to count character frequencies.
steps.tip: If lengths are different, they can't be anagrams - we can check this first as an optimization.

steps.explanation: First, count all characters in string s. Start with 'a'.
After counting all characters in s, we have: a=3, n=1, g=1, r=1, m=1.
Now process string t = 'nagaram'. For each character, decrement the count. Start with 'n'.
Continue with 'a': decrement a from 3 to 2.
After processing all of t, all counts should be 0 for a valid anagram.
steps.code:
return all(count == 0 for count in counts.values())
return True
steps.tip: Time complexity: O(n) where n is the length of the strings. Space complexity: O(1) since we have at most 26 letters.
